SettingDefinitions.Description: Apply ASR only per rule exclusions.
SettingDefinitions.Name: ASROnlyPerRuleExclusions

SettingDefinitions.Description: Apply ASR only per rule exclusions.
SettingDefinitions.Name: ASROnlyPerRuleExclusions

SettingDefinitions.Description: This rule detects suspicious properties within an obfuscated script.
SettingDefinitions.DisplayName: Block execution of potentially obfuscated scripts
SettingDefinitions.Name: BlockExecutionOfPotentiallyObfuscatedScripts

SettingDefinitions.Description: Apply ASR only per rule exclusions.
SettingDefinitions.Name: ASROnlyPerRuleExclusions

SettingDefinitions.Description: This rule prevents VBA macros from calling Win32 APIs.
SettingDefinitions.DisplayName: Block Win32 API calls from Office macros
SettingDefinitions.Name: BlockWin32APICallsFromOfficeMacros

SettingDefinitions.Description: Apply ASR only per rule exclusions.
SettingDefinitions.Name: ASROnlyPerRuleExclusions

SettingDefinitions.Description: This rule blocks the following file types from launching unless they meet prevalence or age criteria, or they're in a trusted list or an exclusion list: Executable files (such as .exe, .dll, or .scr).
SettingDefinitions.DisplayName: Block executable files from running unless they meet a prevalence, age, or trusted list criterion
SettingDefinitions.Name: BlockExecutableFilesRunningUnlessTheyMeetPrevalenceAgeTrustedListCriterion

SettingDefinitions.Description: This rule prevents Outlook from creating child processes, while still allowing legitimate Outlook functions.
SettingDefinitions.DisplayName: Block Office communication application from creating child processes
SettingDefinitions.Name: BlockOfficeCommunicationAppFromCreatingChildProcesses

SettingDefinitions.Description: This rule blocks Office apps from creating child processes. This includes Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote, and Access.
SettingDefinitions.DisplayName: Block all Office applications from creating child processes
SettingDefinitions.Name: BlockAllOfficeApplicationsFromCreatingChildProcesses

SettingDefinitions.Description: Apply ASR only per rule exclusions.
SettingDefinitions.Name: ASROnlyPerRuleExclusions

SettingDefinitions.Description: Apply ASR only per rule exclusions.
SettingDefinitions.Name: ASROnlyPerRuleExclusions

SettingDefinitions.Description: This rule prevents attacks by blocking Adobe Reader from creating additional processes.
SettingDefinitions.DisplayName: Block Adobe Reader from creating child processes
SettingDefinitions.Name: BlockAdobeReaderFromCreatingChildProcesses

SettingDefinitions.Description: Apply ASR only per rule exclusions.
SettingDefinitions.Name: ASROnlyPerRuleExclusions

SettingDefinitions.Description: This rule helps prevent credential stealing, by locking down Local Security Authority Subsystem Service (LSASS).
SettingDefinitions.DisplayName: Block credential stealing from the Windows local security authority subsystem
SettingDefinitions.Name: BlockCredentialStealingFromWindowsLocalSecurityAuthoritySubsystem

SettingDefinitions.Description: Apply ASR only per rule exclusions.
SettingDefinitions.Name: ASROnlyPerRuleExclusions

SettingDefinitions.Description: This rule prevents scripts from launching potentially malicious downloaded content. Malware written in JavaScript or VBScript often acts as a downloader to fetch and launch other malware from the Internet.
SettingDefinitions.DisplayName: Block JavaScript or VBScript from launching downloaded executable content
SettingDefinitions.Name: BlockJavaScriptOrVBScriptFromLaunchingDownloadedExecutableContent

SettingDefinitions.Description: Apply ASR only per rule exclusions.
SettingDefinitions.Name: ASROnlyPerRuleExclusions

SettingDefinitions.Description: This rule block webshell creation for servers.
SettingDefinitions.Name: BlockWebshellCreationForServers

SettingDefinitions.Description: With this rule, admins can prevent unsigned or untrusted scripts (such as VBScript, JavaScript) and executables (such as .exe, .dll, .scr files) from removable USB drives, including attached SD cards, from running.
SettingDefinitions.DisplayName: Block untrusted and unsigned processes that run from USB
SettingDefinitions.Name: BlockUntrustedUnsignedProcessesThatRunFromUSB

SettingDefinitions.Description: Apply ASR only per rule exclusions.
SettingDefinitions.Name: ASROnlyPerRuleExclusions

SettingDefinitions.Description: This rule prevents malware from abusing WMI to attain persistence on a device. Fileless threats employ various tactics to stay hidden, to avoid being seen in the file system, and to gain periodic execution control. Some threats can abuse the WMI repository and event model to stay hidden.
SettingDefinitions.DisplayName: Block persistence through WMI event subscription
SettingDefinitions.Name: BlockPersistenceThroughWMIEventSubscription

SettingDefinitions.Description: Apply ASR only per rule exclusions.
SettingDefinitions.Name: ASROnlyPerRuleExclusions

SettingDefinitions.Description: This rule blocks executables that impersonate or are copies of system tools & binaries found on the machine.
SettingDefinitions.DisplayName: [PREVIEW] Block use of copied or impersonated system tools
SettingDefinitions.Name: BlockUseOfCopiedOrImpersonatedSystemTools

SettingDefinitions.Description: Apply ASR only per rule exclusions.
SettingDefinitions.Name: ASROnlyPerRuleExclusions

SettingDefinitions.Description: Apply ASR only per rule exclusions.
SettingDefinitions.Name: ASROnlyPerRuleExclusions

SettingDefinitions.Description: Apply ASR only per rule exclusions.
SettingDefinitions.Name: ASROnlyPerRuleExclusions

SettingDefinitions.Description: This rule prevents an application from writing a vulnerable signed driver to disk. In-the-wild, vulnerable signed drivers can be exploited by local applications - that have sufficient privileges - to gain access to the kernel. Vulnerable signed drivers enable attackers to disable or circumvent security solutions, eventually leading to system compromise. The Block abuse of exploited vulnerable signed drivers rule does not block a driver already existing on the system from being loaded.
SettingDefinitions.DisplayName: Block abuse of exploited vulnerable signed drivers (Device)
SettingDefinitions.Name: BlockAbuseOfExploitedVulnerableSignedDrivers

SettingDefinitions.Description: Apply ASR only per rule exclusions.
SettingDefinitions.Name: ASROnlyPerRuleExclusions

SettingDefinitions.Description: This rule blocks processes created through PsExec and WMI from running. Both PsExec and WMI can remotely execute code, so there is a risk of malware abusing this functionality for command and control purposes, or to spread an infection throughout an organization's network.
SettingDefinitions.DisplayName: Block process creations originating from PSExec and WMI commands
SettingDefinitions.Name: BlockProcessCreationsFromPSExecAndWMICommands

SettingDefinitions.Description: Apply ASR only per rule exclusions.
SettingDefinitions.Name: ASROnlyPerRuleExclusions

SettingDefinitions.Description: This rule prevents Office apps, including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint, from creating potentially malicious executable content, by blocking malicious code from being written to disk.
SettingDefinitions.DisplayName: Block Office applications from creating executable content
SettingDefinitions.Name: BlockOfficeApplicationsFromCreatingExecutableContent

SettingDefinitions.Description: Apply ASR only per rule exclusions.
SettingDefinitions.Name: ASROnlyPerRuleExclusions

SettingDefinitions.Description: Apply ASR only per rule exclusions.
SettingDefinitions.Name: ASROnlyPerRuleExclusions

SettingDefinitions.Description: This rule blocks code injection attempts from Office apps into other processes.
SettingDefinitions.DisplayName: Block Office applications from injecting code into other processes
SettingDefinitions.Name: BlockOfficeApplicationsFromInjectingCodeIntoOtherProcesses

SettingDefinitions.Description: This rule blocks attempts of restarting a machine in SAFE mode.
SettingDefinitions.DisplayName: [PREVIEW] Block rebooting machine in Safe Mode
SettingDefinitions.Name: BlockRebootingMachineInSafeMode

SettingDefinitions.Description: This rule provides an extra layer of protection against ransomware. It scans executable files entering the system to determine whether they're trustworthy. If the files closely resemble ransomware, this rule blocks them from running, unless they're in a trusted list or an exclusion list.
SettingDefinitions.Name: UseAdvancedProtectionAgainstRansomware

SettingDefinitions.Description: This rule blocks the following file types from launching from email opened within the Microsoft Outlook application, or Outlook.com and other popular webmail providers: Executable files (such as .exe, .dll, or .scr), Script files (such as a PowerShell .ps, VisualBasic .vbs, or JavaScript .js file).
SettingDefinitions.DisplayName: Block executable content from email client and webmail
SettingDefinitions.Name: BlockExecutableContentFromEmailClientAndWebmail

SettingDefinitions.Description: Attack surface reduction rules help prevent actions that malware often abuse to compromise devices and networks.
SettingDefinitions.Name: AttackSurfaceReductionRules

SettingDefinitions.Description: The previous name was EnableGuardMyFolders and changed to EnableControlledFolderAccess. This policy enables setting the state (On/Off/Audit) for the controlled folder access feature. The controlled folder access feature removes modify and delete permissions from untrusted applications to certain folders such as My Documents. Value type is integer and the range is 0 - 2.
SettingDefinitions.Name: EnableControlledFolderAccess

SettingDefinitions.Description: This policy setting allows you to prevent Attack Surface reduction rules from matching on files under the paths specified or for the fully qualified resources specified. Paths should be added under the Options for this setting. Each entry must be listed as a name value pair, where the name should be a string representation of a path or a fully qualified resource name. As an example, a path might be defined as: c:\Windows to exclude all files in this directory. A fully qualified resource name might be defined as: C:\Windows\App.exe. Value type is string.
SettingDefinitions.Name: AttackSurfaceReductionOnlyExclusions
